message.content: The main goal of the Turing Test is to determine whether a computer or machine can exhibit intelligent behavior that is indistinguishable from that of a human being. In other words, it tests the ability of an artificial intelligence system to convince humans that they are interacting with another human rather than a machine. If a computer can fool most human evaluators in this way, it could be said to have passed the Turing Test and exhibited human-like intelligence.
